data.title: fixing d2k refinery
data.body: Harvesters have a tendency to  get stuck at the refinery. Changing the footprint so it's less likely.

data.title: Can see enemy movement on minimap if area was revealed
data.body: Small regression from #3020. Enemies covered in fog should not be visible on the mini-map although that gives the radar an interesting advantage.

data.title: shortened conyard cooldown 5 -> 4 secs
data.body: The cooldown on the construction yard building is too damn long.

data.title: move `random map` button in ra into mapchooser
signal beacon
data.body:
I found this on the forum about "drawing" signals for your friends. http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16271

I really like this idea, but for now, maybe its a good idea to give a player the possibility to send your mates a signal beacon: "ALT + leftClick" marks an area or just puts a big, bold, player colored "!" on that clicked position and some nice ping sound. Disappears after 1 minute.

data.title: fix crash in ObserverShroudSelectorLogic if two players have the same name
Auto updating idea
data.body: i was thinking maybe it would be good to add some kind of auto update system to OpenRA, or some kind of alert that would alert you when there is a new Playtest or Release. Then install it.

data.title: nerf mines, please
data.body:
You can lay mines faster than produce tanks. 
http://imgur.com/VzH33ZP
http://imgur.com/aCydm74
What to counter sth like this? Game just stopped. 

Some ideas: 
- time expiration (mines disappear after x seconds)
- force attack should work against mines to clear mine field
- slower laying (MUCH SLOWER!)
- mines should cost credits
- sth to disable them, but fast. (cause if you put artie behind them you dont have time to disable)
- chain reaction if explode (like 5 mines near the exploding mine explode, too)
- a limit to how many mines each player can make
- or just like in original RA: every mine needs to be layed manually (non automatic)

I suggest deleting mine layer from game until fixed. Very few ppl use it anyways and its very annoying.

data.title: sequences error not that helpful
data.body:
In my modding, I've been somewhat often getting the error,

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `ftnk` does not have any sequences defined.
```

The problem is that it's not accurate. It happens:
- When a .SHP is missing
- When OpenRA just doesn't like a .SHP for whatever reason 
- When you specify a trait in the sequences (e.g. muzzle: shpname) that cannot find the shpname for it, even if the trait (muzzle) is not in use.

data.title: crash when loading cnc mod from other mod
data.body:
I haven't been modding cnc but have been making other custom mods. When I tried loading the cnc mod, I got this error:
"Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Mods.RA.SpawnMapActors`"
http://pastebin.com/Fk3X3G69
I think it's referring to the shellmap.

It happens when I'm switching to cnc mod, from my other custom mod ("Mixed Universe"). When I change settings.yaml manually, cnc loads OK.

data.title: Drawing tips/advices/tactics to other players of the team
data.body:
Taken from this forum: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16271
Idea from epicelite

It would be great if we could draw notes on the game for teammates to see. Like draw lines and stuff? So you can tell your teammates where your attacking exactly and coordinate easier.

"I'm chronoing my tanks here, be ready with that iron curtain!"
Then you could draw an X in the exact spot you plan to teleport your tanks too, and your allies could see it.

"I'm gonna attack here you come in from the other side."
Draw an arrow where your units will be going in, and an X on what they will be attacking!

The pen tool will only be visible to you and your allies, possibly make it to you can send a spy into an enemy radar dome to see enemies notes(for a limited time)!

Here, I made an example with a random screenshot I had laying around.

![Example](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/368752/e51d0734-a2c7-11e2-85ba-f451f9e7a851.png)

Mouse1 = Temporary line that disappears after X time
Mouse2 = Permanent line that will stay till its manually erased

See what I'm getting at here?

Could this be used for griefing? Yes.

data.title: scrolling to top in chat game lobby
data.body:
if you want to read old chat in lobby, you scroll to top, and as soon as someone writes sth it pushes you back down.
And if you try to change nick it behaves weird. Dont know what it might be.

data.title: Making bridges indestructible for now.
data.body:
Making bridges indestructible.
Rationale: 
-many maps don't work when bridges are destructible (most or all of the crossings are bridges)
-bridges will be repairable in the future. At this point, an engi can come and re-open it, but in the meantime, they shouldn't be destroyed.
-if someone wants to make a map with destructible bridges, they still can, by editing the .yaml themselves. This should be the default, though.

(FWIW, bridges were not destructible in C&C 1.)

data.title: spectator mode players view bug
data.body: If you are specing and watching the game from one players perspective ("playername's view") you can still see the veteran signs from an enemy unit walking around.

data.title: Oramap in wrong mod folder crash map browser and openra
data.body:
If you in 0408 try to create ra game with a cnc map in that folder, the game will crash...
The editor will also fail, but not crash. just not showing anything....

When I download map from irc I do not always know what mod it is, so then its crashing my game...

data.title: Make the word READY blink
data.body:
Could it be possible to make the word "READY" blink ? 
(it would make produced units/buildings recognized faster by players).

![ready](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/362815/d84f86fc-a1f1-11e2-80d6-0d51b78c781c.gif)

data.title: infantry deaths inherit scale
data.body:
Currently when an infantryman which uses the Scale trait dies, their infantry death animation does not inherit the scale, and shows at their original size, which can be quite large.
Would be nice if fixed.
Thank you.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/210165-infantry-deaths-inherit-scale?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Removed some annoyances from the RA temperat shellmap
data.body: inspired by #3014.

data.title: Changes DEBIAN/md5sums permissions to 0644
data.body: Should fix #2797 where lintian claims that our package is bad quality because of this.

data.title: Better name for automatic port forwarding and enabled by default if all pre-checks end well.
data.body: No need to ignore the suggestion after all those try catch monsters checked if it is going to work. `Server.AllowPortForward` should make it easier to understand what the variable does now that there are more to control the default Nat behavior.

data.title: making bridges indestructible for now
data.body:
Making bridges indestructible.
Rationale: 
-many maps don't work when bridges are destructible (most or all of the crossings are bridges)
-bridges will be repairable in the future. At this point, an engi can come and re-open it, but in the meantime, they shouldn't be destroyed.
-if someone wants to make a map with destructible bridges, they still can, by editing the .yaml themselves. This should be the default, though.

(FWIW, bridges were not destructible in C&C 1.)

data.title: Automatic MCF package creation and upload to Desura
data.body:
This will help deployment workflow because I currently have to fire up the Desura client on Windows and Linux and click together the patches with a GUI from a fresh install.
- [x] investigate if and how https://github.com/lodle/Desurium/tree/master/src/tools work
- [ ] install them on the build server
- [ ] create packaging scripts to automate MCF creation and uploading

Typing in the changelog and submitting it for approval on http://www.desura.com/games/openra/publish/execute is probably not automatize-able, but this can be done from any browser on any OS.

data.title: Thrown away turrets of husks are drawn on top of everything
data.body: This looks glitchy when other tanks roll over them.

data.title: Add shroud sprite variations
data.body:
Repeating the same shroud sprite along the edges of the (explored) map looks almost as bad as a hard edge. It would be nice if there were multiple versions which were "randomly" chosen to break the repetitiveness.

This could be done the easy way, or the awesome way:
- The easy way would be to do only the N/E/S/W tiles and select them deterministically to keep a static border but break the repetitiveness of the hard map edges.
- The awesome way would be to make variants of all the tiles, and then pick them randomly each frame to animate the shroud.

data.title: oil derricks color change when captured
data.body:
oil derricks do not change the color when they get captured by engis 
+they get enemy right before you captured it. --> get some soldiers next to oil derrick and capture it. the soldiers attack it while its beeing captured.

plane which drops crates ist enemy, too.

SORRY! was map specific: texas sea.

data.title: save logs
data.body:
For bug hunting it would be really nice to have an option to keep the log so that openra does not overwrite it when you restart the game.

data.title: Refactor per-player shrouds.
data.body: I wanted to fix the shellmap-shroud bug, but was pretty horrified when I saw the state of the shroud code. This simplifies things and (hopefully) doesn't regress anything.
